questions.question: How common is magic in the campaign world?
options: Magic is rare and mysterious, with only a few individuals possessing it.
Magic is uncommon but known, with certain regions or professions having access to it.
Magic is common and integrated into everyday life, with many individuals and societies using it regularly.
Magic is ubiquitous, with almost everyone having some minor magical ability or access to magical items.

questions.question: Are there any restrictions on certain types of magic or spells?
options: Necromancy is banned and heavily punished.
Only divine magic is allowed, arcane magic is forbidden.
No restrictions exist, all types of magic are permitted.
Certain spells that can cause large-scale destruction are restricted.

questions.question: How do the laws of the land view magic and its practitioners?
options: Magic is highly regulated, with strict laws governing its use.
Magic is accepted but monitored by the authorities.
Magic is freely practiced without any legal restrictions.
Magic is feared and outlawed, with practitioners being hunted.

questions.question: Are there any cultural or regional variations in the availability and use of magic?
options: Magic is more common in urban areas than in rural ones.
Certain regions are known for specific types of magic, like fire magic in volcanic areas.
Different cultures have unique magical traditions and spells.
Magic is uniformly distributed with no significant regional variations.

questions.question: How will magic items be distributed throughout the campaign?
options: Magic items will be rare and hard to find.
Magic items will be relatively common, found in most dungeons and treasure hoards.
Magic items will be distributed through specific quests and missions.
Magic items will be available for purchase in shops in major cities.

questions.question: Are there specific shops or locations where players can buy magic items?
options: Yes, there are dedicated magic item shops in large cities.
Magic items can be found in general stores but are very expensive.
Magic items are only available through black market dealers.
No, magic items must be found through adventuring and quests.

questions.question: Are there any cursed or dangerous magic items the players might encounter?
options: Yes, cursed items are scattered throughout the campaign.
No, all magic items are beneficial.
Some items have hidden dangers or side effects.
Cursed items are rare but can be powerful and tempting.

questions.question: What types of magic items (weapons, armor, utility, etc.) will be most prevalent?
options: Weapons and armor will be most common.
Utility items like potions and rings will be most common.
A balanced mix of all types will be available.
Rare artifacts and relics will be the primary focus.

questions.question: Will there be any opportunity for players to craft or enchant their own magic items?
options: Yes, players can learn to craft and enchant items through special quests.
No, crafting and enchanting are not available in this campaign.
Players can craft items if they find the right materials and recipes.
Enchanting services can be hired from NPCs but players cannot do it themselves.

questions.question: Are there any items that are specifically tied to the lore or history of the campaign?
options: Yes, there are legendary items with deep ties to the campaign's history.
No, all items are generic and not tied to specific lore.
Some items have minor connections to the campaign's lore.
Many items are tied to the lore and can reveal hidden aspects of the story.

questions.question: How accessible are spellcasting services for hire, such as healing or teleportation?
options: Very accessible, with many spellcasters for hire in towns and cities.
Somewhat accessible, with services available only in larger settlements.
Rarely accessible, with only a few known locations offering such services.
Not accessible, players must rely on their own abilities or those of their party.

questions.question: Are there any restrictions or limitations on hiring spellcasters?
options: Yes, only certain guilds or temples offer spellcasting services.
No, any spellcaster can be hired for a price.
Restrictions based on the type of spell or service requested.
Limited to high-level spells only.

questions.question: What are the costs associated with hiring spellcasting services?
options: Costs are high, making it a luxury service.
Moderate costs, affordable for mid-level players.
Low costs, accessible to most players.
Variable costs based on the spell level and complexity.

questions.question: Will there be any powerful spellcasters that can serve as mentors or allies to the players?
options: Yes, several powerful spellcasters will aid the players.
No, players must rely on their own abilities.
One or two key spellcasters will serve as mentors.
Mentors will be available, but only through completing specific quests.

questions.question: What themes or motifs will the unique or custom magic items follow?
options: Elemental themes like fire, water, air, and earth.
Cultural themes tied to the different regions and peoples of the campaign.
Mystical and otherworldly themes, with items of unknown origin.
Historical themes connected to ancient civilizations and lost knowledge.

questions.question: How will players discover or earn these unique items?
options: Through completing challenging quests and missions.
By exploring ancient ruins and dungeons.
Through interactions with key NPCs and allies.
As rewards for major story milestones.

questions.question: Will there be any special requirements or quests to unlock the power of certain items?
options: Yes, players must complete specific quests to unlock their full potential.
No, items are fully functional once found.
Some items have latent powers that require special actions to activate.
Special rituals or conditions may be needed to fully unlock some items.

questions.question: Are there any items that grow in power or evolve with the players?
options: Yes, some items level up with the players.
No, all items have fixed abilities.
Certain rare items have the potential to grow in power.
Items can evolve through specific conditions or achievements.

questions.question: How many legendary or artifact-level items will be in the campaign?
options: A handful of legendary items will be present.
Several artifacts will be scattered throughout the campaign.
Only one or two truly legendary items will exist.
Many legendary items will play a role in the story.

questions.question: What role will these items play in the overall story?
options: Central to the main plot and critical to the players' success.
Important but not essential, offering significant benefits.
Minor role, mostly serving as powerful tools for the players.
Background elements, enhancing the lore and world-building.

questions.question: Will the players need to complete specific challenges or tasks to acquire these items?
options: Yes, each legendary item requires a significant quest to obtain.
No, they can be found through exploration and luck.
Some items require specific challenges, others can be found easily.
Legendary items are rewards for defeating major foes.

questions.question: Are there any risks or downsides associated with using these powerful items?
options: Yes, using them may attract powerful enemies or have side effects.
No, they are purely beneficial.
Some items have curses or drawbacks.
Risks vary depending on the item's nature and history.

questions.question: How will the players learn about the history and properties of magic items they find?
options: Through identifying spells and abilities.
By consulting with knowledgeable NPCs or scholars.
Through ancient tomes and scrolls found during their adventures.
By experimenting with the items and uncovering their secrets.

questions.question: Are there any tomes, scrolls, or sages that can provide information on magic items?
options: Yes, several key locations and NPCs offer this knowledge.
No, players must rely on their own skills to learn about items.
Some rare tomes and scrolls are hidden throughout the campaign.
Knowledgeable NPCs can be found in major cities and guilds.

questions.question: Will there be any opportunities for players to uncover lost or forbidden magical knowledge?
options: Yes, through quests and exploring ancient ruins.
No, all magical knowledge is readily available.
Some hidden knowledge can be found by solving puzzles or riddles.
Forbidden knowledge can be obtained but at a great risk.

questions.question: How will magical knowledge be disseminated among the players?
options: Through shared libraries and guilds.
By finding and reading ancient texts and scrolls.
Through mentorship and training by powerful spellcasters.
By experimenting and learning through trial and error.

questions.question: What role do magical creatures and beings play in the campaign world?
options: Central role, driving much of the story and conflicts.
Important but secondary, mainly serving as allies or enemies.
Minor role, with few magical creatures encountered.
Varied, with some regions having many magical beings and others having none.

questions.question: Are there any specific regions or areas known for their magical properties or inhabitants?
options: Yes, several regions are famed for their magical nature.
No, magic is evenly spread throughout the world.
Certain hidden or lost areas are rich in magic.
Magic is concentrated around ancient ruins and sacred sites.

questions.question: How do different factions or societies view and interact with magic?
options: Some embrace it and integrate it fully into their culture.
Others fear and shun it, leading to conflict.
Different factions have unique relationships with magic.
Magic is universally respected and valued.

questions.question: Are there any natural phenomena or locations that are inherently magical?
options: Yes, several natural sites have strong magical auras.
No, magic is confined to beings and items.
Certain rare phenomena can have magical effects.
Magical locations are tied to the history and lore of the world.

questions.question: How will the distribution of magic items be balanced to ensure fairness among players?
options: Magic items will be carefully assigned to ensure balance.
Random distribution with adjustments for fairness.
Players will have equal opportunities to earn magic items.
Magic item distribution will be tied to character development and story.

questions.question: How will you handle the potential for certain magic items to overshadow others?
options: Ensure that each item has unique strengths and weaknesses.
Limit the number of powerful items each player can have.
Balance encounters and challenges based on the items.
Adjust item power levels as needed to maintain balance.

questions.question: Will there be any checks in place to prevent magic from becoming too powerful or game-breaking?
options: Yes, through careful item design and campaign balance.
No, players can use items as they see fit.
Certain powerful items will have restrictions or costs.
Balance will be maintained through story and encounters.

questions.question: How will you ensure that all players feel their characters are equally valued, regardless of their access to magic items?
options: Focus on role-playing and story over mechanics.
Ensure non-magical items and abilities are equally useful.
Create opportunities for all characters to shine in their own ways.
Adjust item distribution and encounter difficulty as needed.
